column1: Colleen,  YouTube is a harsh place to put your life on.  Iâ€™ve watched you for years and every day since the start of Covid!  I just want you to remember and know you are loved.  You are going through a very difficult situation and I know from experience in my life that when something you love and something that defines who you are as a person gets ripped from you because of a mistake or rumors or hateful people it can be so overwhelming and feel so awful that you start to question who you are as a person and what is your purpose for being here.  Let me tell you in case you havenâ€™t heard it from anyone but the people closest to you,  you are worthy of forgiveness for your mistakes!  You are worthy of love and not just from those closest to you right now.  You have touched many people and done so much good.  Donâ€™t let other peopleâ€™s agendas and need for gossip define who you are right now!  Let â€œthemâ€ cancel you!  You donâ€™t exist to make â€œthemâ€ happy!  I feel like from being a part of your life for the past few years that the mistakes made in the past are just that, the past!  Iâ€™m still rooting for you and your family and I know Iâ€™m not the only one!

column1:
Seems like people forget there are two sides to every story...
Whether you have a platform or not, NO ONE deserves the amount of hate both sides have received.
People can heal from trauma privately instead of making it the entire internet's business. Getting revenge & trying to tear someone's life & reputation apart from someone who hurt you DOESN'T provide long term healing. Instant gratification, yes. But not healing.
If you've suffered from any sort of trauma & expect everyone to feel for you, yet you turn around & hurt the person who hurt you back, you are just as guilty of the person who caused you harm.
Everyone is responsible for their own healing.
And everyone deserves to move on & gain healing.
Leave Colleen alone.
Leave those affected by Colleen's mistakes alone.
Stick around for her content, or leave if she upsets you.
Just quit spreading hate.
And actually have the strength to walk away from what brings you down instead of arming yourselves with pitchforks.
Whether you've made horrible mistakes or not, you deserve healing.
And you deserve peace.
But no one can give you peace.
That's YOUR responsibility.
Not anyone else's.

I will admit my bias because Iâ€™ve been watching Colleens YouTube videos for almost 6 years now for context I never really liked Miranda Sings. Iâ€™ve frankly never watched Miranda sings content unless it was for Colleen because I liked Colleen. I always loved their familyâ€™s channels and I watched Rachel, Colleen, and sometimes Chris. The whole Ballinger family thatâ€™s what I grew up with. Only recently had I started watching Colleens Vlogs less consistently Because Iâ€™ve been busy with college. However, when all of this came out about Colleen a few years ago, I remember believing the person that said it and when Colleen originally addressed it everyone universally came to the understanding that she had made a mistake. The irony is all of this drama thatâ€™s coming back up is it is the same thing that people tried to cancel her with years ago. Now, by no means, am I trying to justify any of her actions, but what Iâ€™m saying is for this video specifically, I appreciated the apology. I have grown up, feeling like Iâ€™ve known Colleen and known her personality, and she always turns to art when she doesnâ€™t know how else to express herself. thatâ€™s some thing I quite liked about her because I end up doing the same thing in my personal life. The point Iâ€™m trying to make here is this apology is perfect for her in my opinion because this is an example of who Colleen is and how she deals with problems. I think itâ€™s beautiful frankly, when an artist pours their heart into their work. I know some are saying that they would prefer for her to have been more professional in this video, but contrary to popular belief, when all of this came up years ago, she did address all of this and made a formal apology years ago. So now when people are bringing up the past again and trying to cancel her with the same old thing, I think this is a perfect way to respond and I understand if you disagree thatâ€™s all right. I could be wrong, and I could be blinded by my own nostalgia but itâ€™s my opinion. Colleen if you happen to see this comment, just know that one of your fans has forgiven you, and still loves you.â¤


Also, just bring a little bit more perspective into this. I really donâ€™t appreciate you guys calling her a pedophile because I am a sexual assault victim. I was raped by a 30 year old man when I was six years old he was a pedophile. Colleen making a few out of taste jokes and weird comments does not make her a pedophile. Please donâ€™t label people with such horrific terms when they havenâ€™t done anything to deserve it.

Colleen I hope youâ€™re doing ok. Just know you do have people out there who still want the best for you. You have made me laugh for years, gave me happiness as a depressed tween with no friends, helped others in their journeys to stardom, are accepting of the loser kids and gay kids and weird theater and art kids, outcasted kids, poured your heart into your work, prioritized your fans over your own health many times, youâ€™re talented, and seemingly a wonderful mother, sister, daughter and wife. The way people have berated you, threatened you, and body shammed you over this is so vile and toxic. If the goal for this was accountability, all of those other things didnâ€™t have to happen. This was a smear campaign. I donâ€™t argue with there being inappropriate jokes made, I donâ€™t want to diminish other people feelings about their experiences. This whole situation to me has been more about hurting and humiliating you and tearing apart your character with irreversible allegations that arenâ€™t always presented in a truthful way. Calling someoneâ€™s groomer is a very serious and legally punishable thing and implies sexual abuse/relationships or other illegal activity with underage people. Itâ€™s not just talking to, joking, interacting with and being friendly with young people or every celebrity, Daily vlogger, YouTuber, Tiktoker, influencer would be considered a groomer. The YouTube community was really just beginning in 2012 and most of these YouTubers we know now had ever had experience on the platform or even much with the internet/social media altogether. MySpace was the first real â€œsocial mediaâ€ and it was very common for larger accounts to communicate with â€˜fansâ€™ of all ages in groups and messages and pen pals with younger people like an older/younger sister type relationship. That was how this generation of YouTubers grew up on the internet. Having boundaries with internet followers wasnâ€™t something they knew they needed until they blew up enough that they had probably already crossed the boundaries most have in place today. How are you supposed to know the limitations as an internet famous person if no one had ever been internet famous before? The jokes Colleen/Miranda have made are sometimes inappropriate or even bad taste but never with ill intent never with the intention to coerce, manipulate, or groom.

I'm trying to understand this timeline of events...
Three years ago she was accused of inappropriate contact with underage fans. One in particular came out and made a video. She took accountability and apologized for her inappropriate choices and has grown and changed since then.
Meanwhile the person who made a video was doxed, bullied and harassed.
Now more corroborating evidence about her inappropriate contact has come to light and people want her to apologize again? I don't understand that. She has already apologized. If anything it's the people who bullied that one person who came out with the allegations that should apologize.

I think that maybe singing this wasn't the best move, but she is a human and people are emotional and flawed and that's kinda ok. I don't know what glowing saint person you want to see on here, but I always felt like she was honest about her missteps and mistakes and took strides to learn from them.

I'm 40 and it would kill me if people still judged me based on who I was 15 years ago. Anyways. That's my two cents.

I enjoyed the song and it is built to the brim with truths about our society. A lot of people, from my experience, likes to formulate a thought based on information they learned without grabbing the concept that all information received isn't 100% revealed. As time progresses, incremental information will be discovered if the individual is vigilant and ready to absorb the information they are oblivious of noticing from their previous experience. Most people, like myself, prefer not to wait and would rather be noticed now versus being noticed some time in the future. People who put contemplative thought with the content they create (e.g. books, movies, etc.) release their media weeks, months, and maybe a year before they release their content for public viewing; yet people without the experience of being patient and will reply based on their current life situation and hopefully learn from their actions if it is a mistake. Their are two common phrases I'm feeling is relatable with my perception trying to gain fame and/or notoriety (clout): "players going to play" and "any publicity is good publicity".

column1:
I just recently learned about this ad, and I gotta say that I can kind of see why people think the way that they do. If anything the marketing team was just too politicized and incompetent.

Look, I can see that the goal was to target sexual minorities to sell expand the customer base, but the large part of the customer base was probably ticked off by the focus being on someoneâ€™s celebration of their transition and this advertisement being, in a half-assed way, linked to march madness. Some people also say that this person (Dylan is her name?) has an audience which includes a decent amount of minors. It is highly inappropriate to do advertising via her channel in that case.

So, whether right or wrong, a company has a customer base, and ideally, they should respect that customer base. Some people disliked the advertisement. Alright, so stop taking that advertisement route and do it in a more honest and less provocative manner next time (after a long while). Apologize and do advertisement strategies that appeal to everyone or most people.

And this is the issue: if bud lightâ€™s marketing team was honest about doing their work, they would do the above and actually submit to their customer base looking to continue to increase their companyâ€™s sales. A wrong thing to do would be to proceed to say that your customers are out of touch. Thatâ€™s not marketing. Thatâ€™s politicization, and a bitter aggression against the majority of your consumer base for not being politically brainwashed into accepting anything that is pro-gayism.

There is nothing wrong with gay people. However, there is something wrong about expecting everyone to feel the same way about gay people being promoted as gay people and leaving the beer as a secondary promotion while the collaboration should be secondary to the product.

Some people will like the ad, some people will dislike the ad, and some people donâ€™t care either way. Itâ€™s disgusting to expect everyone to think the same way. It just doesnâ€™t make sense, and it would be biased to say anything else other than â€œAnheuser-Buschâ€™s marketing team is bad at marketing and political maniacs.â€

By the way, I would say this if it went the other way, but thereâ€™s usually a â€œprogressiveâ€ skew to these advertisement regressions. Companies should respect their customers or crumble. They exist only because the people work hard (most of the time) and spend their money on said products. Customers are venerable. And companies can only have a little bit of that venerability if they acknowledge that.
This is the new face of sobriety.

I'm a Baby Boomer, so I come from a time in Americana where men were men and women did there best to be great wives, mothers and homemakers!

Everyone's roles were very defined. And then it seems that around 1977 when disco was big with partying, coke and lot's of sex, a lot more infidelity was just a side effect. Then more and more people started living together and more divorces. After this, people coming out as gay was the big thing, and NOW women trying to be men and men trying to be women!

I feel for all you young people that didn't get to grow up at a time when parents, though unhappy, sometimes really strove to keep a good family unit together in behalf of the kids. A time when we played OUTSIDE, our Mom's made us lunch, we ate together as a family and for some, they waited for their Dad to come home to get SPANKED with a belt. ğŸ˜… Everyone knew the rules and there was very little back talk.

So for me to observe such upheaval, and a time when not only do women not want to be viewed as a "homemaker" but rather a successful "influencer business person" that travels to exotic places, dines out at the finest restaurants, wears designer clothes, fly's on private jets, wears expensive jewelry....that men subsidize, it's all just so foreign to me. This world is so messed up and ya'll have NO FRAME OF REFERENCE! How would you know better cause this was the world that your generations were born into!

So with this.... man/woman to have a following, it is what it is. I did sales and marketing for years and so I get that they were going after a specific market share by letting those people know that they appreciate their business.

Now if this ad had been directed to the MASSES.... then I would understand the uproar. I'm not into their lifestyle but that is them. So if he/she has a following that is in agreement with her then I get that they did this for them.

I will NEVER accept trans AND Gay stuff being PUSHED on me as being NORMAL, but as long as they don't try to INFLUENCE or PROMOTE it to kids, then we need to let them live their lives. Many people HATE Black people (not sure why, when we are the ones that were used as slaves, beaten raped, families broken up, lynched, harassed by police, punished more severely by judges, denied government programs like the GI Bill, denied Home, Business and Mortgage loans to get out of the slums that the Government literally made for us while making white construction company's rich, denied equal scooling, illegally used for medical tests. And many of YOU have what, reason to hate US? But that's another discusion).

I say that to say, that it would be so awesome to "turn our color off" just so that we could be treated like everyone else!!! But we CAN'T. So I don't feel a lot of sympathy for the Gay or LGBT community to be crying over not being treated like everyone else. They DON'T have to choose to put it in people's faces.We don't have a choice cause many of you make up your mind about me as soon as you lay your eye's on me without knowing that I could very well be the funniest cool buddy of yours! So sad.

Sorry for getting off track. Bottom line is that unless you feel the need to CHOOSE to follow this individuals profile, fucking let it go, it has nothing to do with YOU or with a company trying to expand it's market share. Or are you going to boycott any grocery stores where they shop, as well??? Are you?

This world is so messed up, so all you can do is try to be the best person you can be and associate with people that are like minded. If your other buddies are also racist then stick with them and continue to poison one another with your triggered nonsense. And I know that you will like that I used the word "TRIGGER" cause it's reminds you of the word... not so fast! ğŸ˜‚

Anyways, best wishes to everyone including, these unique people, Anheuser-Busch, and even you guys that hate me for no valid reason! ğŸ˜Š

Side note. I am allowed to ramble cause I'm old. And don't forget, there was a time where many sporting events were boycotted because blacks were gonna be allowed to play in the game.

Anheuser-Busch stock value (the percentages are related to the initial stock value, on march 31st, 2023):
03.31.2023, 1 day before the first airing of the commercial: 66,73$
04.12.2023, 11 days after the commercial: 63,38$ (-5%)
05.02.2023, 1 month later: 63,67% (still -5%)
05.16.2023, 1.5 months later: 59,69$ (-10%)
06.01.2023, 2 months later: 53,81$ (-19%)
The value wandered in the 50s until november, on december in the 60s and is now at 63.44$, more or less what it was before.
Now I'm not at all an expert, I did this out of curiosity, but I kind of expected a bigger and quicker drop in value after the "incident", and I wasn't at all expecting the value to come back to what it was before.

hard one to understand this move from Bud.... why would the brand do this?... I get that you might want to diversify your brand. I get that you want to move away from beer guzzling frat boys and redneck image at the BBQ. (no, not stating beer drinkers are always this.. just.. making a point.. relax).. But.. you're then going to target the audience that is in the VAST minority in the world (but for some reason heavily catered to).
Not only are you targeting a negligible audience when it comes to possible sales, but at the same time that new audience and the spokesperson that you decide to use aren't "supported" or accepted by a significant portion of your current consumers... how else did Bud expect this to go down?... non-beer drinkers aren't all of a sudden going to start drinking beer.. but your current consumers will certainly stop drinking your brand when you change the "image" of that brand.. from ordering a bud light to have a beer, now ordering a bud light is a political woke statement that no-one wants to take part of when ordering a beer... same as how the Ford Raptor now quickly became the car to "represent" trans.. simply because Ford put a rainbow on it... Ford Raptor owners, clearly the most woke people out there....? why would you mess that image up.

When Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (AOC) said, "Yo sÃ­ soy boricua pa' que tÃº lo sepas," she was expressing pride in her Puerto Rican heritage. The phrase translates to "I am indeed Puerto Rican, just so you know."

### Context and Meaning:

1. **Cultural Identity**: By saying this, she emphasizes her identity as a Puerto Rican, asserting her connection to the island and its culture.

2. **Defiance and Pride**: The phrase can also reflect a sense of pride and defiance, especially in the face of any challenges or misconceptions about her identity.

3. **Engagement with Audience**: AOC often uses bilingual language to connect with her constituents and the broader Latino community, showcasing her roots and solidarity with Puerto Ricans.

Overall, the statement reinforces her identity and serves as a reminder of her cultural background and the significance of Puerto Rican heritage in her life and political work. ğŸ¤·â€â™‚ï¸
